channel.title: Advice
channel.description:
Would you guys like to see these in an RSPS?
Armour trimming Dragon weapon smithing
I'll add more soon.

Alot of old pimpscape sources had dragon armor smithing

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:28, topic:385736”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=481488.msg3526735#msg3526735 date=1299882762]
@Rash

Can’t you just take molten glass, recolor it yellow, and rename it molten gold?
[/quote]Yea but custom items fail :|[/quote]
Unless applied correctly, not really. I had a fairly successful server that had plenty of customs. All of them though, were implemented via custom quests, treasure trails, and even my tournament minigame. Customs only completely fail when they are not available to the normal players without the assistance of staff. Make them part of the legit gameplay and they will do fine. That is, unless they are over powered.

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:18, topic:385736”][quote author=Rash link=topic=481488.msg3525962#msg3525962 date=1299811068]

I was thinking a process like this:
gold+armour+hammer = partially complete
armour+chisel = complete

You need to melt the gold down. That’s like me hammering a picture into a picture frame with a nail. There is a proper way to do things.

I know, I know.
I have never tried creating a model of my own, so Im not sure what do use for molten gold.

[/quote]

Looks like we have another one for the model section. Click the link in my signature to begin your journey.

@david- chisel is for trimming the armor, so it can stay normal trimmed, but when you do that, you’re physically pushing off the metal on the surface. Chiseling it enough will make a small trough, in which gold can fit into.[/quote]

Reading now

Davidi2:

But that’s not how you trim armour! You don’t damage the armour and put gold into it, you plate it.

How is the molten gold going to stay in place, without a groove?

Read full topic

item.title: Advice

item.description:

But that’s not how you trim armour! You don’t damage the armour and put gold into it, you plate it.

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:15, topic:385736”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=481488.msg3525960#msg3525960 date=1299810943]

I was thinking a process like this:
gold+armour+hammer = partially complete
armour+chisel = complete

You need to melt the gold down. That’s like me hammering a picture into a picture frame with a nail. There is a proper way to do things.
[/quote]

I know, I know.
I have never tried creating a model of my own, so Im not sure what do use for molten gold.[/quote]

Looks like we have another one for the model section. Click the link in my signature to begin your journey.

@david- chisel is for trimming the armor, so it can stay normal trimmed, but when you do that, you’re physically pushing off the metal on the surface. Chiseling it enough will make a small trough, in which gold can fit into.

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:385736”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=481488.msg3525946#msg3525946 date=1299810499]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=481488.msg3525945#msg3525945 date=1299810451]

I was thinking gold leafs (from construction) and just plating the armour.

That would require the making of a whole new model…
[/quote]Huh? Why?

I’m interpreting this as you placing the leaf in the center of the body, like a chest piece.
[/quote]Read my edit

Also maybe like plate body and legs needs 2 leaves, or w/e[/quote]

Ah. Or my way.

  1. Get armor… lets say rune, for example.
  2. Needed skills = 40 smithing, 60 crafting (for rune items)
  3. Take gold bar, put in furnace. With a metal bucket in your inventory (damn minecraft) you will now have molten gold (w\e it’s called when u melt a metal down into a liquid)
  4. Take chisel, use on armor, this makes it trimmed.
  5. For gold, simply use the bucket with the armor, and imagine ur character pouring it on.

Read full topic

That would require the making of a whole new model…[/quote]Huh? Why? Trimmed armour is just plated on the edges… I was thinking like Gold leaf + armour + ??? = trimmed armour
The ?? being a tool used to combine them. Like a hammer, glue, idk

Read full topic

item.title: Advice
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:2, topic:385736”]Neither.

Armor trimming - add treasure trails

Dragon weapon smithing - unless you can add an entire system of getting items such as dragon hides, bones, scales, along with some kind of rune underskeleton, then no.[/quote]

hmm, okay.

It kind of depends on the extent of the creativity. Such as, are you going to be doing like god armors, and trimmed robes? Or will you plan on making certain items trimmable to boost in skills. (ie Golden Hammer?) Etc.

Any (t) or (g) item in game will be able to be created.
Im not sure as to how yet, just wanted general feedback.

Davidi2:

bahahahahha armour trimming actually sounds like a good idea. I’m adding this to my server

Stealing my idea

[quote=“krackkid, post:4, topic:385736”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=481488.msg3525932#msg3525932 date=1299809940]
bahahahahha armour trimming actually sounds like a good idea. I’m adding this to my server
[/quote]David is adding to his so he can make a video of him trimming armour, then show people on rs, scam :problem:?[/quote]

lmao.

[quote=“reyx7, post:5, topic:385736”]Am I the only one that disagrees with armor trimming?
Unless you have gold bars, a chisel, a furnace, and good hands, maybe a small bucket or vial (something that can hold molten gold).[/quote]
Thats what im going to be adding, for (g) armour.

Read full topic
